title: Rent Board Housing Inventory
description: A. SUMMARY Beginning in 2022, the law requires owners of residential housing units in San Francisco to report certain information about their units to the San Francisco Rent Board on an annual basis. For units (other than condominium units) in buildings of 10 residential units or more, owners were required to begin reporting this information to the Rent Board by July 1, 2022, with updates due on March 1, 2023 and every March 1 thereafter. For condominium units and units in buildings with less than 10 residential units, reporting began on March 1, 2023 with updates due every March 1 thereafter. Owners are also required to inform the Rent Board within 30 days of any change in the name or business contact information of the owner or designated property manager. The Rent Board uses this information to create and maintain a “housing inventory” of all units in San Francisco that are subject to the Rent Ordinance. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED The Rent Board has developed a secure website portal that provides an interface for owners to submit the required information (The Housing Inventory). The Rent Board uses the information provided to generate reports and surveys, to investigate and analyze rents and vacancies, to monitor compliance with the Rent Ordinance, and to assist landlords and tenants and other City departments as needed. The Rent Board may not use the information to operate a “rental registry” within the meaning of California Civil Code Sections 1947.7 – 1947.8. C. UPDATE PROCESS The Housing Inventory is continuously updated as it receives submissions from the public. The portal is available to the public 24/7. The Rent Board Staff also makes regular updates to the data during regular business hours, and the data is shared to DataSF every 24 hours. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET It is important to note that this dataset contains information submitted by residential property owners and tenants. The Rent Board does not review or verify the accuracy of the data submitted. Please note that historical data is subject to change. Notes for Analysis - Addresses have been anonymized to the block level - Latitude & Longitude are the closest mid-block point to the unit - Each row is a unit. To count total units, first select a year then count unique ids. Do not sum unit count.

columns.name: unique_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each submission record generated by DataSF

columns.name: block_num
columns.description: Block number of the property

columns.name: unit_count
columns.description: Total number of residential units in the property

columns.name: case_type_name
columns.description: Name of the submission type

columns.name: submission_year
columns.description: Fee year for which the submission is received

columns.name: block_address
columns.description: Property address of this residential unit (geo-masked to block)

columns.name: occupancy_type
columns.description: Occupancy type reported for this residential unit

columns.name: occupancy_or_vacancy_date_year
columns.description: Year of the current occupancy

columns.name: bedroom_count
columns.description: Number of bedrooms in this residential unit

columns.name: bathroom_count
columns.description: Number of bathrooms in this residential unit

columns.name: square_footage
columns.description: Square footage of the unit in 250 square foot increments

columns.name: monthly_rent
columns.description: Monthly rent in $250 increments

columns.name: base_rent_includes_water
columns.description: Whether water/sewer charges are included in the tenant base rent

columns.name: base_rent_includes_natural_gas
columns.description: Whether natural gas charges are included in the tenant’s base rent

columns.name: base_rent_includes_electricity
columns.description: Whether electricity charges are included in the tenant’s base rent

columns.name: base_rent_includes_refuse_recycling
columns.description: Whether refuse/recycling charges are included in the tenant’s base rent

columns.name: base_rent_includes_other_utilities
columns.description: Whether other utility charges are included in the tenant’s base rent

columns.name: past_occupancy
columns.description: Whether there was a past occupancy within the last 12 months

columns.name: vacancy_date
columns.description: Vacancy dates

columns.name: signature_date
columns.description: Date of submission

columns.name: occupancy_or_vacancy_date_history
columns.description: Past occupancy/vacancy dates

columns.name: year_property_built
columns.description: Year the property was constructed based on the Assessor’s historical tax rolls

columns.name: point
columns.description: Point representing the block midpoint

columns.name: analysis_neighborhood
columns.description: Analysis Neighborhood of the inventoried property

columns.name: supervisor_district
columns.description: Current supervisor district of the inventoried property

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp representing the last time the source data was updated

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp representing the last time the data was loaded into the Open Data Portal
